PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Thanks! (and also thanks Calle for reviewing!)
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9363601446/job/25774747622)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9363601446/job/25774747392)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Doesn't this hold for any `PresheafOfModules`? Do we have this (as a simp lemma)?
No, this is specific to the ring presheaf considered as a presheaf of modules over itself.
Does `simps` generate good simp lemmas?
The `apply_coe` is good. The autogenerated one for the sheaf version is not good enough, but I have added one.

```suggestion
lemma unit_map_one {X Y : Cáµ’áµ–} (f : X âŸ¶ Y) : (unit R).presheaf.map f (1 : R.obj X) = (1 : R.obj Y) :=
```
It might be a good idea to write the lemma like this. This makes it so that the `erw [unit_map_one]` below would become a `rw`. Then we have the `simp` lemma `PresheafOfModules.map_apply` which could be used to deduce the version without the `.presheaf`

I don't like that it makes it longer though. I think `(unit R).map` should be the preferred spelling. For the `erw` problem, maybe we should make `PresheafOfModules.map` reducible, but it might be a head symbol and it might not work. Anyway these problems are everywhere in the AG library and I believe some smart people are thinking about how to solve it (Kim, Johan, Dagur etc.) and I think we can leave this as is for now. 
Hopefully we can have a thorough discussion or brainstorm at the AG workshop.

To clarify, I'm not stopping you from figuring this out. Another smart mind gives a greater chance in coming up with a better solution! It's just that I believe it is a bigger problem and I don't think it is possible to solve it here.
Okay thanks for the answer! I wasn't aware of how widespread these issues were (and that some people are thinking on how to solve it!), then its fair to leave it as it is I think :)

There is a mathematical issue here also: when studying morphisms of presheaves of modules, sometimes we want to look at the underlying morphisms of presheaves of abelian groups (this is related to `.presheaf`), and sometimes we want to look at the family of linear maps between modules of sections (this is `Hom.app`). I would think that `Hom.app` should be the better spelling when applicable.
But then we can at least get rid of `erw [unit_map_one]` by doing `rw [â† map_apply, unit_map_one]`

> There is a mathematical issue here also: when studying morphisms of presheaves of modules, sometimes we want to look at the underlying morphisms of presheaves of abelian groups (this is related to `.presheaf`), and sometimes we want to look at the family of linear maps between modules of sections (this is `Hom.app`). I would think that `Hom.app` should be the better spelling when applicable.

I agree with this. Do you have any thoughts on the `@[simp]` from `map_apply` in this file then, i.e. should it be removed? Because then `dsimp` would automatically try to phrase things in terms of the underlying presheaves of abelian groups, but maybe thats not a big problem?
Thanks for the suggestion! I have slightly improved simp lemmas in this commit https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13461/commits/ed087fd3bc36f70c3944968e8ef9d828f10b8382

```suggestion
        erw [â† naturality_apply, unit_map_one]
```
The lemma `PresheafOfModules.naturality_apply` seems even closer to what you want in this situation, my hope is that somehow that lemma can be used to remove the need for `erw` but I can't seem to get it to work
Thanks!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: the free (pre)sheaf of modules of rank 1
